meanings.definition: Standardized text or language used repeatedly in legal documents or contracts.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer included the same boilerplate in all the contracts.
meanings.sent2: The boilerplate at the end of the document contained the standard terms.
meanings.sent3: The judge found humor in the boilerplate language of the legal agreement.
meanings.sent4: The boilerplate of the contract was as predictable as the sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The boilerplate text was like a broken record, repeating itself over and over.

meanings.definition: A template or form that can be easily adapted for various purposes.
meanings.sent1: She used the same boilerplate for all her emails.
meanings.sent2: The company's boilerplate for proposals saved time and effort.
meanings.sent3: The boilerplate template was like a magic wand for creating documents.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the familiar boilerplate of a politician's promises.
meanings.sent5: The boilerplate form was a lifesaver when filling out paperwork.
